nodes.bodyText: nit: consider renaming scanAssignments to probeSymbols (since "assignments" term is usually used for Assignments instances, IIUC).
yes, should have been probeSymbols, renamed it now

nit: consider using Map#merge() here, e.g.:
dynamicFilterDomains.merge(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue(), Domain::intersect);

nodes.bodyText: Make probeSymbols a Set to explicitly avoid duplicates
LocalDynamicFilter is created per join node. Therefore TupleDomain should be fine here (empty domain means join filters everything)
Simplified to make changes only in LocalDynamicFiltersCollector

let's rename this method to addDynamicFilter ane make it accept Map<Symbol, Domain>
Make io.prestosql.sql.planner.LocalDynamicFilter#getResultFuture return Map<Symbol, Domain>, but make conversion from TupleDomain<String> to Map<Symbol, Domain> in io.prestosql.sql.planner.LocalDynamicFilter#convertTupleDomain
you shouldn't set entire map to empty. It might contain predicates for other joins

I would rename this method to be more explicit, e.g
getDynamicFilter

comment for the future
TBH: now I think LocalDynamicFilter has too big responsibility. It should produce TupleDomain<String> (where string is filter id) instead of TupleDomain<Symbol>.
Each table scan should translate String -> Symbol itself.
Don't need optional here, use empty map initially.
remove this comment (I don't think it will be relevant)

you could use stream here:
buildChannels.keySet().stream()
  .flatMap(filterId -> probeSymbols.get(filderId).stream())
  .collect(toImmutableMap(probeSymbol -> probeSymbol, omain.none(types.get(probeSymbol)));

you could add a similar comment:
one of the join build symbols has no non-null values, therefore no symbols can match predicate
Please also make sure that adding none domain for particular symbol doesn't affect other symbols (set them to none domain too)
I think loop was better here, please revert. Sorry
